reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 perfect family computer
reviewText:
I can't say enough good things about this little computer. I was looking for something small, compact, and affordable for a family desktop computer for my younger two kids (9 &11) so they can learn how to navigate using a computer at home, while also being taught Internet safety somewhere I can keep a close eye on them. This was the prefect solution, because it's so small, I was able to set up their computer next to mine in my very tiny home office. As an added bonus, I can now do my work at my computer, while my kids play on theirs, and we get to spend time together that would normally be just working hours. (I'm self-employed, and spend an unfortunate amount of time cloistered away in my office.)

Also, setup was super easy, because we all have various Apple devices. Added bonus is that I don't have to worry about the younger kids breaking it the way I would with a laptop or tablet (aka something portable with a screen), nor can they sneak it during a time when they're not supposed to be on screens.

All in all, highly recommend. I might even be looking into one for my parents' to replace their old-as-dirt Windows 7 desktop computer!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 This Tiny Monster is a Beast! (Mac Mini M4 with 24GB RAM)
reviewText:
I'm absolutely loving the 2024 Mac Mini with the M4 chip! I went for the 24GB RAM configuration, and this little machine is a productivity powerhouse.

My work revolves around heavy browser use - countless tabs, web applications, and online tools running simultaneously. The Mac Mini handles it all flawlessly. The M4 chip is incredibly fast and efficient. I've never experienced such smooth performance, even with dozens of tabs open and multiple web apps running.

What truly amazes me is how quiet and cool it runs, even when I'm pushing it hard. My old desktop sounded like a jet engine, but this little guy is whisper-quiet. Plus, it takes up barely any space on my desk!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great little computer
reviewText: I got this to replace an M1 Mac Mini and have been very happy.  I started by moving my old mac to a different room with a different monitor, keyboard, mouse, ethernet.  I then got this one plugged in and got a wired keyboard and mouse ready for first boot.  My normal keyboard and mouse are bluetooth, not Apple, and I wasn't expecting them to work on first boot.  However, the process of syncing both keyboard and mouse was effortless and I never needed the wired ones.  I had some trouble with the migration assistant, but eventually got that worked out by temporarily disabling the firewall or something.  Things went smoothly after that.  After a reboot, and signing in as my user, I was presented with my familiar desktop, configured identically to my old mac.  To me, this was a good out of box experience.  My only gripe so far has been with a lack of high DPI scaling in the OS.  I use this on a 4K/120Hz/HDR monitor and the only way to scale the interface is to change the resolution.  Changing the resolution to anything in between 1K and 4K for me disables high refresh or color depth.  So, I'm running full resolution so that I get the best picture, but the interface is small.  This scaling is different than what I'm familiar with in Windows or Ubuntu, in which they keep the high resolution but redraw the interface.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2025

However, the process of syncing both keyboard and mouse was effortless and I never needed the wired ones. I had some trouble with the migration assistant, but eventually got that worked out by temporarily disabling the firewall or something. Things went smoothly after that. After a reboot, and signing in as my user, I was presented with my familiar desktop, configured identically to my old mac. To me, this was a good out of box experience. Changing the resolution to anything in between 1K and 4K for me disables high refresh or color depth. So, I'm running full resolution so that I get the best picture, but the interface is small. This scaling is different than what I'm familiar with in Windows or Ubuntu, in which they keep the high resolution but redraw the interface.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Fast and flawless
reviewText: I replaced my 32MB 2018 Intel Mini with the M4 Pro Mini with 24GB.  It's really fast, and works great.  I don't really know if the regular M4 would be enough for me, but after seeing some comparisons on YouTube I decided the extra cost was probably worth it.  I typically run multiple browsers, Mail, Messages, Excel, Word, Spotify, and ThinkOrSwim (stock trading software) and other apps simultaneously, with two 4K monitors.  When I click something in ThinkOrSwim, I want it to execute NOW, so the M4 Pro's speed is reassuring.  Nothing I do seems to bother this Mac.  The (fully-loaded) Intel Mini was fine for 6 years, I expect at least the same out of the M4 Pro Mini.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    2X Size plus 2X speed SSD support: hits the sweet spot for a development station
reviewText: Of course this Mac Mini was top-notch in terms of packaging--it's an Apple product. It was a nice surprise to see that the 512GB drive hits speeds higher than my 512GB Macbook Air as well. The Thunderbolt 4 ports work great, and it interfaces well with my Sabrent mini TB4 PD hub, achieving 40Gbps easily for my external SSD whether connected directly or through the hub.I have evaluated a few TB4 cables and not been disappointed. There are two reported USB ports on the front. So far, I have seen only 10Gbps at best out of each, but I don't have any true USB4 devices to test higher speeds. The HDMI easily supports my 2K monitor at 144Hz, but my TB4 to DisplayPort 2.1 cable does a better job in both display appearance and refresh rate, hitting my monitor's top rate of 165Hz, some of which is probably due to DisplayPort. It shows no issues with tearing. On top of that, it works connected through my TB4 mini-hub, while still allowing me to hit top speed on my external 4TB  M.2 SSD, which runs at 3,100MB/s read/write while the display is also attached, meaning I still have 3 TB4 ports free (2 direct, 1 additional hub port), plus the 2 USB ports in front. It was easily worth the price difference between the 256GB model and the 512GB model, allowing me a near-pocketable portable development setup (sans monitor).
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2024

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This Mac Mini M4 Pro is my first Mac PC ever.
reviewText: My HP Windows 10 PC is getting close to be end of support so I thought now is as good a time as ever to make the switch to a Mac. This Mac Mini M4 Pro probably was overkill for me as I don't really do anything that resource intensive on a PC. I probably should have purchased the M4 with 512GB SSD instead but I wanted to future proof my purchase. So far I can say the transition to a Mac as been very smooth and easy for me but I am in IT. I love how fast this thing is for how small and quiet it is. I have to say I am also liking the Mac OS which I find to be very intuitive. Since I already love my iPad and iPhone this move only made sense and I am loving it. This is a great computer but if you don't need the power just get the Mac Mini M4 base model and maybe the 512GB SSD upgrade, or not, as the 256GB drive is pretty small. You can always run an external SSD and stick with the 256GB drive. The reason for 4 stars is the power button on the bottom is absolutely idiotic. I don't care if most people put their Macs to sleep I shut off all my computers and they last forever so don't tell me it is hard on the components. Also the price of upgrades in Memory and Drive size are ridiculous.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I hate to complain. But using spoken Siri is difficult to do at best on a Mac Mini M4
reviewText: I cut my teeth on Apple IIe's back in the early 1980's and have been a loyal customer ever since. Don't get me wrong the Mac Mini M4 is an outstanding little computer. From performance to a very cool form factor. My complaint is that it is proving to be difficult to get spoken Siri to work. The Mac Mini has no built in microphone. I have researched using my iPhone 12 Max Pro as a video camera and microphone but with little success. I have looked at purchasing an external microphone that will make spoken Siri work but what I am finding from others that have done the same they are not successful. Hopefully a fix is in the works from Apple. Otherwise, one of the main features of the Mac Mini that was attractive to me is a dud.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Third-party peripherals
reviewText: I took my 3-year old 4K monitor and Logi wireless keyboard and mouse from my Windows box, and they worked perfectly on the Mac mini. I did have to buy a USB-A to USB-C adapter for the wireless keyboard receiver into. I made sure to buy a USB 3.1 compatible adapter, since that is what the Mac mini uses. I plugged the adapter into a spare Thunderbolt 4 port on the rear.I used an OWC 1TB Express NVMe Thunderbot external drive instead of purchasing the SDD upgrade from Apple. Spent a couple hundred dollars less and got double the storage. This enclosure is bus-powered, couldn't be simpler. Mine came pre-formatted for Apple. Truly plug and play.Before I installed any apps or migrated any data, I moved my Home folder to the external drive. Everything pinned itself there going forward, that seems to be the best way to integrate with an external drive.I simply cannot believe how well Apple has leap-frogged over Google and Microsoft with this gear. As long as you stay with the base model, it's a deal that just can't be beat.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2024

    Very Impressed
reviewText: I have never been an apple guy.  I have used the Microsoft operating system my entire life in business  and personal.  I am now retired and expected to have problems as I moved to Apples operating system.  I have to say that the computer as tiny as it is, is extremely capable.  I does everything my large Dell running windows can do and a lot more and a whole lot faster.  The learning curve  was not bad at all.  I think purchasing the Apple Mac was a wise move.  It is fast, it is easy and for a change computing is fun.Just outstanding!!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Just Amazing!
reviewText: As I now retired pro photographer/imager I have long depended on Apple Mac computer systems for my daily work. Such integrate so perfectly with the entire Photoshop editing/creation system.  But even higher end Mac systems of just a few years ago are now basically out of date. Photoshop (and many other apps) today need speed and power like never before, and the Apple Silicon system is the way to go.The Mac Mini  4, even in its base model, has power and speed to spare. It is truly an amazing computer.Mated to an Apple Studio Display it is this digital imager's dream computing system.I coud not recommend it more highly for imagers such as myself.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I have no regrets
reviewText: I have a collection of Macs and I have never bought a new one before. I bought the 24/512 model before the price went up and the delivery went out. I'm not processing video or doing any other heavy lifting with it. Mostly I play a couple of video games with it and I know it is overspec-ed for what I do but - so fast so smooth and just a pleasure to use. I know that most people want a Windows machine to game with and maybe they need it but the games I play on Steam work fine with this and never having to deal with Windows updates is a bonus that is hard to quantify. In short, I love this little box and you will too.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    HDMI port is a little loose
reviewText: Everything works great so far. I used migration assistant and ethernet cable on old & new macmini computers to transfer all my data. It took about 1 1/2 hrs to complete the transfer and everything transfered great and works like it should. I really like the speed of the new macmini. It comes with 16 gig ram standard now. It opened up my wifes silhouette program in 7 seconds and with the old 2014 macmini it took 15-20 minutes. The only issue I had was a loose HDMI port. I kept losing my connection. After trying 4 HDMI cables I found one that I bought at Best Buy years ago for $ 40 that fit tighter. It was suppose to be a better cable for the price. I guess it really was worth the price.

reviewTitle:

    It Be Tiny, But It be Powerful!
reviewText: As soon as I saw this Mac mini and read about it, I knew I had to have one. The size and power of the device is just incredible. While I have a few different kinds of Macs, this is an excellent one for those thinking about making the switch from Windows. I’ve read some reviews, and the biggest complaint people have is where the power button is. That’s just silly to me. If all you have to complain about when buying a new PC is the power button location, you’ve got yourself an awesome machine. I recommend this as an upgrade to anyone who has a M1 or M2 device or older. (Much less ann Intel device).  And if you’re thinking about switching from Windows to Mac? Start here. You won’t be disappointed.

I def. recommend getting a thunderbolt dock for this. Most of my life is still usb A and this thing only has usb C.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 perfect family computer
reviewText:
I can't say enough good things about this little computer. I was looking for something small, compact, and affordable for a family desktop computer for my younger two kids (9 &11) so they can learn how to navigate using a computer at home, while also being taught Internet safety somewhere I can keep a close eye on them. This was the prefect solution, because it's so small, I was able to set up their computer next to mine in my very tiny home office. As an added bonus, I can now do my work at my computer, while my kids play on theirs, and we get to spend time together that would normally be just working hours. (I'm self-employed, and spend an unfortunate amount of time cloistered away in my office.)

Also, setup was super easy, because we all have various Apple devices. Added bonus is that I don't have to worry about the younger kids breaking it the way I would with a laptop or tablet (aka something portable with a screen), nor can they sneak it during a time when they're not supposed to be on screens.

All in all, highly recommend. I might even be looking into one for my parents' to replace their old-as-dirt Windows 7 desktop computer!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 This Tiny Monster is a Beast! (Mac Mini M4 with 24GB RAM)
reviewText:
I'm absolutely loving the 2024 Mac Mini with the M4 chip! I went for the 24GB RAM configuration, and this little machine is a productivity powerhouse.

My work revolves around heavy browser use - countless tabs, web applications, and online tools running simultaneously. The Mac Mini handles it all flawlessly. The M4 chip is incredibly fast and efficient. I've never experienced such smooth performance, even with dozens of tabs open and multiple web apps running.

What truly amazes me is how quiet and cool it runs, even when I'm pushing it hard. My old desktop sounded like a jet engine, but this little guy is whisper-quiet. Plus, it takes up barely any space on my desk!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great little computer
reviewText: I got this to replace an M1 Mac Mini and have been very happy.  I started by moving my old mac to a different room with a different monitor, keyboard, mouse, ethernet.  I then got this one plugged in and got a wired keyboard and mouse ready for first boot.  My normal keyboard and mouse are bluetooth, not Apple, and I wasn't expecting them to work on first boot.  However, the process of syncing both keyboard and mouse was effortless and I never needed the wired ones.  I had some trouble with the migration assistant, but eventually got that worked out by temporarily disabling the firewall or something.  Things went smoothly after that.  After a reboot, and signing in as my user, I was presented with my familiar desktop, configured identically to my old mac.  To me, this was a good out of box experience.  My only gripe so far has been with a lack of high DPI scaling in the OS.  I use this on a 4K/120Hz/HDR monitor and the only way to scale the interface is to change the resolution.  Changing the resolution to anything in between 1K and 4K for me disables high refresh or color depth.  So, I'm running full resolution so that I get the best picture, but the interface is small.  This scaling is different than what I'm familiar with in Windows or Ubuntu, in which they keep the high resolution but redraw the interface.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2025

I had some trouble with the migration assistant, but eventually got that worked out by temporarily disabling the firewall or something. Things went smoothly after that. After a reboot, and signing in as my user, I was presented with my familiar desktop, configured identically to my old mac. To me, this was a good out of box experience. Changing the resolution to anything in between 1K and 4K for me disables high refresh or color depth. So, I'm running full resolution so that I get the best picture, but the interface is small. This scaling is different than what I'm familiar with in Windows or Ubuntu, in which they keep the high resolution but redraw the interface.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Fast and flawless
reviewText: I replaced my 32MB 2018 Intel Mini with the M4 Pro Mini with 24GB.  It's really fast, and works great.  I don't really know if the regular M4 would be enough for me, but after seeing some comparisons on YouTube I decided the extra cost was probably worth it.  I typically run multiple browsers, Mail, Messages, Excel, Word, Spotify, and ThinkOrSwim (stock trading software) and other apps simultaneously, with two 4K monitors.  When I click something in ThinkOrSwim, I want it to execute NOW, so the M4 Pro's speed is reassuring.  Nothing I do seems to bother this Mac.  The (fully-loaded) Intel Mini was fine for 6 years, I expect at least the same out of the M4 Pro Mini.

5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    2X Size plus 2X speed SSD support: hits the sweet spot for a development station
reviewText: Of course this Mac Mini was top-notch in terms of packaging--it's an Apple product. It was a nice surprise to see that the 512GB drive hits speeds higher than my 512GB Macbook Air as well. The Thunderbolt 4 ports work great, and it interfaces well with my Sabrent mini TB4 PD hub, achieving 40Gbps easily for my external SSD whether connected directly or through the hub.I have evaluated a few TB4 cables and not been disappointed. There are two reported USB ports on the front. So far, I have seen only 10Gbps at best out of each, but I don't have any true USB4 devices to test higher speeds. The HDMI easily supports my 2K monitor at 144Hz, but my TB4 to DisplayPort 2.1 cable does a better job in both display appearance and refresh rate, hitting my monitor's top rate of 165Hz, some of which is probably due to DisplayPort. It shows no issues with tearing. On top of that, it works connected through my TB4 mini-hub, while still allowing me to hit top speed on my external 4TB  M.2 SSD, which runs at 3,100MB/s read/write while the display is also attached, meaning I still have 3 TB4 ports free (2 direct, 1 additional hub port), plus the 2 USB ports in front. It was easily worth the price difference between the 256GB model and the 512GB model, allowing me a near-pocketable portable development setup (sans monitor).

reviewText: why wouldn't you buy a Mac mini. A little bit of a challenge coming from windows? I mean it only took a few times to become familiar enough with the system to do what I need to do. Can't stress enough the integration with iPhone, Messages pop up and responded to on the desktop, mail syncs better, (you have to purchase a camera), take face time and phone calls on the desktop. If you have an iPhone, ditch Windows and go MAC, why didn't I do it sooner.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This Mac Mini M4 Pro is my first Mac PC ever.
reviewText: My HP Windows 10 PC is getting close to be end of support so I thought now is as good a time as ever to make the switch to a Mac. This Mac Mini M4 Pro probably was overkill for me as I don't really do anything that resource intensive on a PC. I probably should have purchased the M4 with 512GB SSD instead but I wanted to future proof my purchase. So far I can say the transition to a Mac as been very smooth and easy for me but I am in IT. I love how fast this thing is for how small and quiet it is. I have to say I am also liking the Mac OS which I find to be very intuitive. Since I already love my iPad and iPhone this move only made sense and I am loving it. This is a great computer but if you don't need the power just get the Mac Mini M4 base model and maybe the 512GB SSD upgrade, or not, as the 256GB drive is pretty small. You can always run an external SSD and stick with the 256GB drive. The reason for 4 stars is the power button on the bottom is absolutely idiotic. I don't care if most people put their Macs to sleep I shut off all my computers and they last forever so don't tell me it is hard on the components. Also the price of upgrades in Memory and Drive size are ridiculous.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I hate to complain. But using spoken Siri is difficult to do at best on a Mac Mini M4
reviewText: I cut my teeth on Apple IIe's back in the early 1980's and have been a loyal customer ever since. Don't get me wrong the Mac Mini M4 is an outstanding little computer. From performance to a very cool form factor. My complaint is that it is proving to be difficult to get spoken Siri to work. The Mac Mini has no built in microphone. I have researched using my iPhone 12 Max Pro as a video camera and microphone but with little success. I have looked at purchasing an external microphone that will make spoken Siri work but what I am finding from others that have done the same they are not successful. Hopefully a fix is in the works from Apple. Otherwise, one of the main features of the Mac Mini that was attractive to me is a dud.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Third-party peripherals
reviewText: I took my 3-year old 4K monitor and Logi wireless keyboard and mouse from my Windows box, and they worked perfectly on the Mac mini. I did have to buy a USB-A to USB-C adapter for the wireless keyboard receiver into. I made sure to buy a USB 3.1 compatible adapter, since that is what the Mac mini uses. I plugged the adapter into a spare Thunderbolt 4 port on the rear.I used an OWC 1TB Express NVMe Thunderbot external drive instead of purchasing the SDD upgrade from Apple. Spent a couple hundred dollars less and got double the storage. This enclosure is bus-powered, couldn't be simpler. Mine came pre-formatted for Apple. Truly plug and play.Before I installed any apps or migrated any data, I moved my Home folder to the external drive. Everything pinned itself there going forward, that seems to be the best way to integrate with an external drive.I simply cannot believe how well Apple has leap-frogged over Google and Microsoft with this gear. As long as you stay with the base model, it's a deal that just can't be beat.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2024

reviewTitle:

    I have no regrets
reviewText: I have a collection of Macs and I have never bought a new one before. I bought the 24/512 model before the price went up and the delivery went out. I'm not processing video or doing any other heavy lifting with it. Mostly I play a couple of video games with it and I know it is overspec-ed for what I do but - so fast so smooth and just a pleasure to use. I know that most people want a Windows machine to game with and maybe they need it but the games I play on Steam work fine with this and never having to deal with Windows updates is a bonus that is hard to quantify. In short, I love this little box and you will too.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    HDMI port is a little loose
reviewText: Everything works great so far. I used migration assistant and ethernet cable on old & new macmini computers to transfer all my data. It took about 1 1/2 hrs to complete the transfer and everything transfered great and works like it should. I really like the speed of the new macmini. It comes with 16 gig ram standard now. It opened up my wifes silhouette program in 7 seconds and with the old 2014 macmini it took 15-20 minutes. The only issue I had was a loose HDMI port. I kept losing my connection. After trying 4 HDMI cables I found one that I bought at Best Buy years ago for $ 40 that fit tighter. It was suppose to be a better cable for the price. I guess it really was worth the price.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    It Be Tiny, But It be Powerful!
reviewText: As soon as I saw this Mac mini and read about it, I knew I had to have one. The size and power of the device is just incredible. While I have a few different kinds of Macs, this is an excellent one for those thinking about making the switch from Windows. I’ve read some reviews, and the biggest complaint people have is where the power button is. That’s just silly to me. If all you have to complain about when buying a new PC is the power button location, you’ve got yourself an awesome machine. I recommend this as an upgrade to anyone who has a M1 or M2 device or older. (Much less ann Intel device).  And if you’re thinking about switching from Windows to Mac? Start here. You won’t be disappointed.

    Incredible value

I def. recommend getting a thunderbolt dock for this. Most of my life is still usb A and this thing only has usb C.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 perfect family computer
reviewText:
I can't say enough good things about this little computer. I was looking for something small, compact, and affordable for a family desktop computer for my younger two kids (9 &11) so they can learn how to navigate using a computer at home, while also being taught Internet safety somewhere I can keep a close eye on them. This was the prefect solution, because it's so small, I was able to set up their computer next to mine in my very tiny home office. As an added bonus, I can now do my work at my computer, while my kids play on theirs, and we get to spend time together that would normally be just working hours. (I'm self-employed, and spend an unfortunate amount of time cloistered away in my office.)

Also, setup was super easy, because we all have various Apple devices. Added bonus is that I don't have to worry about the younger kids breaking it the way I would with a laptop or tablet (aka something portable with a screen), nor can they sneak it during a time when they're not supposed to be on screens.

All in all, highly recommend. I might even be looking into one for my parents' to replace their old-as-dirt Windows 7 desktop computer!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 This Tiny Monster is a Beast! (Mac Mini M4 with 24GB RAM)
reviewText:
I'm absolutely loving the 2024 Mac Mini with the M4 chip! I went for the 24GB RAM configuration, and this little machine is a productivity powerhouse.

My work revolves around heavy browser use - countless tabs, web applications, and online tools running simultaneously. The Mac Mini handles it all flawlessly. The M4 chip is incredibly fast and efficient. I've never experienced such smooth performance, even with dozens of tabs open and multiple web apps running.

What truly amazes me is how quiet and cool it runs, even when I'm pushing it hard. My old desktop sounded like a jet engine, but this little guy is whisper-quiet. Plus, it takes up barely any space on my desk!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great little computer
reviewText: I got this to replace an M1 Mac Mini and have been very happy.  I started by moving my old mac to a different room with a different monitor, keyboard, mouse, ethernet.  I then got this one plugged in and got a wired keyboard and mouse ready for first boot.  My normal keyboard and mouse are bluetooth, not Apple, and I wasn't expecting them to work on first boot.  However, the process of syncing both keyboard and mouse was effortless and I never needed the wired ones.  I had some trouble with the migration assistant, but eventually got that worked out by temporarily disabling the firewall or something.  Things went smoothly after that.  After a reboot, and signing in as my user, I was presented with my familiar desktop, configured identically to my old mac.  To me, this was a good out of box experience.  My only gripe so far has been with a lack of high DPI scaling in the OS.  I use this on a 4K/120Hz/HDR monitor and the only way to scale the interface is to change the resolution.  Changing the resolution to anything in between 1K and 4K for me disables high refresh or color depth.  So, I'm running full resolution so that I get the best picture, but the interface is small.  This scaling is different than what I'm familiar with in Windows or Ubuntu, in which they keep the high resolution but redraw the interface.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2025

However, the process of syncing both keyboard and mouse was effortless and I never needed the wired ones. I had some trouble with the migration assistant, but eventually got that worked out by temporarily disabling the firewall or something. Things went smoothly after that. After a reboot, and signing in as my user, I was presented with my familiar desktop, configured identically to my old mac. To me, this was a good out of box experience. My only gripe so far has been with a lack of high DPI scaling in the OS. I use this on a 4K/120Hz/HDR monitor and the only way to scale the interface is to change the resolution. Changing the resolution to anything in between 1K and 4K for me disables high refresh or color depth. So, I'm running full resolution so that I get the best picture, but the interface is small. This scaling is different than what I'm familiar with in Windows or Ubuntu, in which they keep the high resolution but redraw the interface.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Fast and flawless
reviewText: I replaced my 32MB 2018 Intel Mini with the M4 Pro Mini with 24GB.  It's really fast, and works great.  I don't really know if the regular M4 would be enough for me, but after seeing some comparisons on YouTube I decided the extra cost was probably worth it.  I typically run multiple browsers, Mail, Messages, Excel, Word, Spotify, and ThinkOrSwim (stock trading software) and other apps simultaneously, with two 4K monitors.  When I click something in ThinkOrSwim, I want it to execute NOW, so the M4 Pro's speed is reassuring.  Nothing I do seems to bother this Mac.  The (fully-loaded) Intel Mini was fine for 6 years, I expect at least the same out of the M4 Pro Mini.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    2X Size plus 2X speed SSD support: hits the sweet spot for a development station
reviewText: Of course this Mac Mini was top-notch in terms of packaging--it's an Apple product. It was a nice surprise to see that the 512GB drive hits speeds higher than my 512GB Macbook Air as well. The Thunderbolt 4 ports work great, and it interfaces well with my Sabrent mini TB4 PD hub, achieving 40Gbps easily for my external SSD whether connected directly or through the hub.I have evaluated a few TB4 cables and not been disappointed. There are two reported USB ports on the front. So far, I have seen only 10Gbps at best out of each, but I don't have any true USB4 devices to test higher speeds. The HDMI easily supports my 2K monitor at 144Hz, but my TB4 to DisplayPort 2.1 cable does a better job in both display appearance and refresh rate, hitting my monitor's top rate of 165Hz, some of which is probably due to DisplayPort. It shows no issues with tearing. On top of that, it works connected through my TB4 mini-hub, while still allowing me to hit top speed on my external 4TB  M.2 SSD, which runs at 3,100MB/s read/write while the display is also attached, meaning I still have 3 TB4 ports free (2 direct, 1 additional hub port), plus the 2 USB ports in front. It was easily worth the price difference between the 256GB model and the 512GB model, allowing me a near-pocketable portable development setup (sans monitor).

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This Mac Mini M4 Pro is my first Mac PC ever.
reviewText: My HP Windows 10 PC is getting close to be end of support so I thought now is as good a time as ever to make the switch to a Mac. This Mac Mini M4 Pro probably was overkill for me as I don't really do anything that resource intensive on a PC. I probably should have purchased the M4 with 512GB SSD instead but I wanted to future proof my purchase. So far I can say the transition to a Mac as been very smooth and easy for me but I am in IT. I love how fast this thing is for how small and quiet it is. I have to say I am also liking the Mac OS which I find to be very intuitive. Since I already love my iPad and iPhone this move only made sense and I am loving it. This is a great computer but if you don't need the power just get the Mac Mini M4 base model and maybe the 512GB SSD upgrade, or not, as the 256GB drive is pretty small. You can always run an external SSD and stick with the 256GB drive. The reason for 4 stars is the power button on the bottom is absolutely idiotic. I don't care if most people put their Macs to sleep I shut off all my computers and they last forever so don't tell me it is hard on the components. Also the price of upgrades in Memory and Drive size are ridiculous.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I hate to complain. But using spoken Siri is difficult to do at best on a Mac Mini M4
reviewText: I cut my teeth on Apple IIe's back in the early 1980's and have been a loyal customer ever since. Don't get me wrong the Mac Mini M4 is an outstanding little computer. From performance to a very cool form factor. My complaint is that it is proving to be difficult to get spoken Siri to work. The Mac Mini has no built in microphone. I have researched using my iPhone 12 Max Pro as a video camera and microphone but with little success. I have looked at purchasing an external microphone that will make spoken Siri work but what I am finding from others that have done the same they are not successful. Hopefully a fix is in the works from Apple. Otherwise, one of the main features of the Mac Mini that was attractive to me is a dud.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Third-party peripherals
reviewText: I took my 3-year old 4K monitor and Logi wireless keyboard and mouse from my Windows box, and they worked perfectly on the Mac mini. I did have to buy a USB-A to USB-C adapter for the wireless keyboard receiver into. I made sure to buy a USB 3.1 compatible adapter, since that is what the Mac mini uses. I plugged the adapter into a spare Thunderbolt 4 port on the rear.I used an OWC 1TB Express NVMe Thunderbot external drive instead of purchasing the SDD upgrade from Apple. Spent a couple hundred dollars less and got double the storage. This enclosure is bus-powered, couldn't be simpler. Mine came pre-formatted for Apple. Truly plug and play.Before I installed any apps or migrated any data, I moved my Home folder to the external drive. Everything pinned itself there going forward, that seems to be the best way to integrate with an external drive.I simply cannot believe how well Apple has leap-frogged over Google and Microsoft with this gear. As long as you stay with the base model, it's a deal that just can't be beat.

It is fast, it is easy and for a change computing is fun.Just outstanding!!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Just Amazing!
reviewText: As I now retired pro photographer/imager I have long depended on Apple Mac computer systems for my daily work. Such integrate so perfectly with the entire Photoshop editing/creation system.  But even higher end Mac systems of just a few years ago are now basically out of date. Photoshop (and many other apps) today need speed and power like never before, and the Apple Silicon system is the way to go.The Mac Mini  4, even in its base model, has power and speed to spare. It is truly an amazing computer.Mated to an Apple Studio Display it is this digital imager's dream computing system.I coud not recommend it more highly for imagers such as myself.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I have no regrets
reviewText: I have a collection of Macs and I have never bought a new one before. I bought the 24/512 model before the price went up and the delivery went out. I'm not processing video or doing any other heavy lifting with it. Mostly I play a couple of video games with it and I know it is overspec-ed for what I do but - so fast so smooth and just a pleasure to use. I know that most people want a Windows machine to game with and maybe they need it but the games I play on Steam work fine with this and never having to deal with Windows updates is a bonus that is hard to quantify. In short, I love this little box and you will too.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    HDMI port is a little loose
reviewText: Everything works great so far. I used migration assistant and ethernet cable on old & new macmini computers to transfer all my data. It took about 1 1/2 hrs to complete the transfer and everything transfered great and works like it should. I really like the speed of the new macmini. It comes with 16 gig ram standard now. It opened up my wifes silhouette program in 7 seconds and with the old 2014 macmini it took 15-20 minutes. The only issue I had was a loose HDMI port. I kept losing my connection. After trying 4 HDMI cables I found one that I bought at Best Buy years ago for $ 40 that fit tighter. It was suppose to be a better cable for the price. I guess it really was worth the price.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    It Be Tiny, But It be Powerful!
reviewText: As soon as I saw this Mac mini and read about it, I knew I had to have one. The size and power of the device is just incredible. While I have a few different kinds of Macs, this is an excellent one for those thinking about making the switch from Windows. I’ve read some reviews, and the biggest complaint people have is where the power button is. That’s just silly to me. If all you have to complain about when buying a new PC is the power button location, you’ve got yourself an awesome machine. reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 perfect family computer
reviewText:
I can't say enough good things about this little computer. I was looking for something small, compact, and affordable for a family desktop computer for my younger two kids (9 &11) so they can learn how to navigate using a computer at home, while also being taught Internet safety somewhere I can keep a close eye on them. This was the prefect solution, because it's so small, I was able to set up their computer next to mine in my very tiny home office. As an added bonus, I can now do my work at my computer, while my kids play on theirs, and we get to spend time together that would normally be just working hours. (I'm self-employed, and spend an unfortunate amount of time cloistered away in my office.)

Also, setup was super easy, because we all have various Apple devices. Added bonus is that I don't have to worry about the younger kids breaking it the way I would with a laptop or tablet (aka something portable with a screen), nor can they sneak it during a time when they're not supposed to be on screens.

All in all, highly recommend. I might even be looking into one for my parents' to replace their old-as-dirt Windows 7 desktop computer!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 This Tiny Monster is a Beast! (Mac Mini M4 with 24GB RAM)
reviewText:
I'm absolutely loving the 2024 Mac Mini with the M4 chip! I went for the 24GB RAM configuration, and this little machine is a productivity powerhouse.

My work revolves around heavy browser use - countless tabs, web applications, and online tools running simultaneously. The Mac Mini handles it all flawlessly. The M4 chip is incredibly fast and efficient. I've never experienced such smooth performance, even with dozens of tabs open and multiple web apps running.

What truly amazes me is how quiet and cool it runs, even when I'm pushing it hard. My old desktop sounded like a jet engine, but this little guy is whisper-quiet. Plus, it takes up barely any space on my desk!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great little computer
reviewText: I got this to replace an M1 Mac Mini and have been very happy.  I started by moving my old mac to a different room with a different monitor, keyboard, mouse, ethernet.  I then got this one plugged in and got a wired keyboard and mouse ready for first boot.  My normal keyboard and mouse are bluetooth, not Apple, and I wasn't expecting them to work on first boot.  However, the process of syncing both keyboard and mouse was effortless and I never needed the wired ones.  I had some trouble with the migration assistant, but eventually got that worked out by temporarily disabling the firewall or something.  Things went smoothly after that.  After a reboot, and signing in as my user, I was presented with my familiar desktop, configured identically to my old mac.  To me, this was a good out of box experience.  My only gripe so far has been with a lack of high DPI scaling in the OS.  I use this on a 4K/120Hz/HDR monitor and the only way to scale the interface is to change the resolution.  Changing the resolution to anything in between 1K and 4K for me disables high refresh or color depth.  So, I'm running full resolution so that I get the best picture, but the interface is small.  This scaling is different than what I'm familiar with in Windows or Ubuntu, in which they keep the high resolution but redraw the interface.

I had some trouble with the migration assistant, but eventually got that worked out by temporarily disabling the firewall or something. Things went smoothly after that. After a reboot, and signing in as my user, I was presented with my familiar desktop, configured identically to my old mac. To me, this was a good out of box experience. Changing the resolution to anything in between 1K and 4K for me disables high refresh or color depth. So, I'm running full resolution so that I get the best picture, but the interface is small. This scaling is different than what I'm familiar with in Windows or Ubuntu, in which they keep the high resolution but redraw the interface.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Fast and flawless
reviewText: I replaced my 32MB 2018 Intel Mini with the M4 Pro Mini with 24GB.  It's really fast, and works great.  I don't really know if the regular M4 would be enough for me, but after seeing some comparisons on YouTube I decided the extra cost was probably worth it.  I typically run multiple browsers, Mail, Messages, Excel, Word, Spotify, and ThinkOrSwim (stock trading software) and other apps simultaneously, with two 4K monitors.  When I click something in ThinkOrSwim, I want it to execute NOW, so the M4 Pro's speed is reassuring.  Nothing I do seems to bother this Mac.  The (fully-loaded) Intel Mini was fine for 6 years, I expect at least the same out of the M4 Pro Mini.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    2X Size plus 2X speed SSD support: hits the sweet spot for a development station
reviewText: Of course this Mac Mini was top-notch in terms of packaging--it's an Apple product. It was a nice surprise to see that the 512GB drive hits speeds higher than my 512GB Macbook Air as well. The Thunderbolt 4 ports work great, and it interfaces well with my Sabrent mini TB4 PD hub, achieving 40Gbps easily for my external SSD whether connected directly or through the hub.I have evaluated a few TB4 cables and not been disappointed. There are two reported USB ports on the front. So far, I have seen only 10Gbps at best out of each, but I don't have any true USB4 devices to test higher speeds. The HDMI easily supports my 2K monitor at 144Hz, but my TB4 to DisplayPort 2.1 cable does a better job in both display appearance and refresh rate, hitting my monitor's top rate of 165Hz, some of which is probably due to DisplayPort. It shows no issues with tearing. On top of that, it works connected through my TB4 mini-hub, while still allowing me to hit top speed on my external 4TB  M.2 SSD, which runs at 3,100MB/s read/write while the display is also attached, meaning I still have 3 TB4 ports free (2 direct, 1 additional hub port), plus the 2 USB ports in front. It was easily worth the price difference between the 256GB model and the 512GB model, allowing me a near-pocketable portable development setup (sans monitor).

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    if you have an Apple phone,
reviewText: why wouldn't you buy a Mac mini. A little bit of a challenge coming from windows? Yes there was and 2 weeks later there still are some things that seem odd, but the integration with my phone and watch make any annoyance I have with not understanding their OS not a problem. 35 years of Windows. some things are hard to unlearn. given time Mac OS won't seem so odd. I mean it only took a few times to become familiar enough with the system to do what I need to do. Can't stress enough the integration with iPhone, Messages pop up and responded to on the desktop, mail syncs better, (you have to purchase a camera), take face time and phone calls on the desktop. If you have an iPhone, ditch Windows and go MAC, why didn't I do it sooner.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This Mac Mini M4 Pro is my first Mac PC ever.
reviewText: My HP Windows 10 PC is getting close to be end of support so I thought now is as good a time as ever to make the switch to a Mac. This Mac Mini M4 Pro probably was overkill for me as I don't really do anything that resource intensive on a PC. I probably should have purchased the M4 with 512GB SSD instead but I wanted to future proof my purchase. So far I can say the transition to a Mac as been very smooth and easy for me but I am in IT. I love how fast this thing is for how small and quiet it is. I have to say I am also liking the Mac OS which I find to be very intuitive. Since I already love my iPad and iPhone this move only made sense and I am loving it. This is a great computer but if you don't need the power just get the Mac Mini M4 base model and maybe the 512GB SSD upgrade, or not, as the 256GB drive is pretty small. You can always run an external SSD and stick with the 256GB drive. The reason for 4 stars is the power button on the bottom is absolutely idiotic. I don't care if most people put their Macs to sleep I shut off all my computers and they last forever so don't tell me it is hard on the components. Also the price of upgrades in Memory and Drive size are ridiculous.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2024

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I hate to complain. But using spoken Siri is difficult to do at best on a Mac Mini M4
reviewText: I cut my teeth on Apple IIe's back in the early 1980's and have been a loyal customer ever since. Don't get me wrong the Mac Mini M4 is an outstanding little computer. From performance to a very cool form factor. My complaint is that it is proving to be difficult to get spoken Siri to work. The Mac Mini has no built in microphone. I have researched using my iPhone 12 Max Pro as a video camera and microphone but with little success. I have looked at purchasing an external microphone that will make spoken Siri work but what I am finding from others that have done the same they are not successful. Hopefully a fix is in the works from Apple. Otherwise, one of the main features of the Mac Mini that was attractive to me is a dud.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Third-party peripherals
reviewText: I took my 3-year old 4K monitor and Logi wireless keyboard and mouse from my Windows box, and they worked perfectly on the Mac mini. I did have to buy a USB-A to USB-C adapter for the wireless keyboard receiver into. I made sure to buy a USB 3.1 compatible adapter, since that is what the Mac mini uses. I plugged the adapter into a spare Thunderbolt 4 port on the rear.I used an OWC 1TB Express NVMe Thunderbot external drive instead of purchasing the SDD upgrade from Apple. Spent a couple hundred dollars less and got double the storage. This enclosure is bus-powered, couldn't be simpler. Mine came pre-formatted for Apple. Truly plug and play.Before I installed any apps or migrated any data, I moved my Home folder to the external drive. Everything pinned itself there going forward, that seems to be the best way to integrate with an external drive.I simply cannot believe how well Apple has leap-frogged over Google and Microsoft with this gear. As long as you stay with the base model, it's a deal that just can't be beat.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2024
reviewTitle_clean: 5.0 out of 5 stars Third-party peripherals

    Just Amazing!
reviewText: As I now retired pro photographer/imager I have long depended on Apple Mac computer systems for my daily work. Such integrate so perfectly with the entire Photoshop editing/creation system.  But even higher end Mac systems of just a few years ago are now basically out of date. Photoshop (and many other apps) today need speed and power like never before, and the Apple Silicon system is the way to go.The Mac Mini  4, even in its base model, has power and speed to spare. It is truly an amazing computer.Mated to an Apple Studio Display it is this digital imager's dream computing system.I coud not recommend it more highly for imagers such as myself.

    I have no regrets
reviewText: I have a collection of Macs and I have never bought a new one before. I bought the 24/512 model before the price went up and the delivery went out. I'm not processing video or doing any other heavy lifting with it. Mostly I play a couple of video games with it and I know it is overspec-ed for what I do but - so fast so smooth and just a pleasure to use. I know that most people want a Windows machine to game with and maybe they need it but the games I play on Steam work fine with this and never having to deal with Windows updates is a bonus that is hard to quantify. In short, I love this little box and you will too.

reviewTitle:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    HDMI port is a little loose
reviewText: Everything works great so far. I used migration assistant and ethernet cable on old & new macmini computers to transfer all my data. It took about 1 1/2 hrs to complete the transfer and everything transfered great and works like it should. I really like the speed of the new macmini. It comes with 16 gig ram standard now. It opened up my wifes silhouette program in 7 seconds and with the old 2014 macmini it took 15-20 minutes. The only issue I had was a loose HDMI port. I kept losing my connection. After trying 4 HDMI cables I found one that I bought at Best Buy years ago for $ 40 that fit tighter. It was suppose to be a better cable for the price. I guess it really was worth the price.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    It Be Tiny, But It be Powerful!
reviewText: As soon as I saw this Mac mini and read about it, I knew I had to have one. The size and power of the device is just incredible. While I have a few different kinds of Macs, this is an excellent one for those thinking about making the switch from Windows. I’ve read some reviews, and the biggest complaint people have is where the power button is. That’s just silly to me. If all you have to complain about when buying a new PC is the power button location, you’ve got yourself an awesome machine. I recommend this as an upgrade to anyone who has a M1 or M2 device or older. (Much less ann Intel device).  And if you’re thinking about switching from Windows to Mac? Start here. You won’t be disappointed.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Incredible value
reviewText: An iphone can easily cost you more. I can't believe Apple has done this. This computer is so affordable I wonder if I am the product. I'm used to using a 2015 MBP for my desktop computer which had so much fan noise. I have to almost put my ear on this thing to hear it doing anything. Mind you most of the time when you're browsing the web this thing isn't using a 10th of it's capacity but even when recording I haven't heard a peep. I def. recommend getting a thunderbolt dock for this. Most of my life is still usb A and this thing only has usb C.

BTW I added an old Samsung nvme 980 pro in a thunderbolt 4 case and tests faster on writes than the internal SSD. Now I have 2tb of user space.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Absolutely Astonished
reviewText:
Having recently transferred all the way to Apple products I have been blown away by how intuitive the devices were. This IMAC is almost like a piece of Alien technology to me. I generally just use my computer for everyday things and so have not much need of a 10 Core 10 CPU powerhouse.

I wanted something that would let me navigate the coming AI wave and grow with me for a few years. This is truly and amazing piece of hardware. It has taken me a while to get everything set up and connected (Accounts/Passwords), but it is truly beautiful to behold and amazing to operate.

Very happy with my purchase!

reviewText:
I like Apple products as long as I don’t have to deal with Apple. Apple service has diminished greatly of late. I went to the local Apple Store with the expectation of walking out of the store with both a new IMac and a new IPhone. This was being purchased for an 75-year old woman to replace her 11-year old IMac, which could no longer be updated (thanks Apple). There was nothing wrong with the original IMac except for this significant problem.

We were at the store 2-days before the release of the the latest IMac, but she wasn’t clutching her pearls waiting for the latest version. So we learn that the store has zero inventory to make room for the latest models. Brilliant shot in the foot Apple. An eager customer shows up at your door to drop $2,000, but they can’t.

We were able to walk out with an IPhone 14 (not the latest model). About 3-weeks into use of the phone, there was a problem connecting to her WiFi network, so she called Apple for assistance. Four hours later, she was unable to use either her old phone or her new one and Apple told her she needed to contact the phone service carrier. Again, thank you Apple. A 15-minute call with the carrier resolved everything even though they were completely uninvolved with the initial setup and transfer to the new phone.

Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Absolutely Astonished
reviewText:
Having recently transferred all the way to Apple products I have been blown away by how intuitive the devices were. This IMAC is almost like a piece of Alien technology to me. I generally just use my computer for everyday things and so have not much need of a 10 Core 10 CPU powerhouse.

I wanted something that would let me navigate the coming AI wave and grow with me for a few years. This is truly and amazing piece of hardware. It has taken me a while to get everything set up and connected (Accounts/Passwords), but it is truly beautiful to behold and amazing to operate.

Very happy with my purchase!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Absolutely Astonished
reviewText:
Having recently transferred all the way to Apple products I have been blown away by how intuitive the devices were. This IMAC is almost like a piece of Alien technology to me. I generally just use my computer for everyday things and so have not much need of a 10 Core 10 CPU powerhouse.

I wanted something that would let me navigate the coming AI wave and grow with me for a few years. This is truly and amazing piece of hardware. It has taken me a while to get everything set up and connected (Accounts/Passwords), but it is truly beautiful to behold and amazing to operate.

Very happy with my purchase!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Apple products are GREAT, Apple service is terrible.
reviewText:
I like Apple products as long as I don’t have to deal with Apple. Apple service has diminished greatly of late. I went to the local Apple Store with the expectation of walking out of the store with both a new IMac and a new IPhone. This was being purchased for an 75-year old woman to replace her 11-year old IMac, which could no longer be updated (thanks Apple). There was nothing wrong with the original IMac except for this significant problem.

We were at the store 2-days before the release of the the latest IMac, but she wasn’t clutching her pearls waiting for the latest version. So we learn that the store has zero inventory to make room for the latest models. Brilliant shot in the foot Apple. An eager customer shows up at your door to drop $2,000, but they can’t.

We were able to walk out with an IPhone 14 (not the latest model). About 3-weeks into use of the phone, there was a problem connecting to her WiFi network, so she called Apple for assistance. Four hours later, she was unable to use either her old phone or her new one and Apple told her she needed to contact the phone service carrier. Again, thank you Apple. A 15-minute call with the carrier resolved everything even though they were completely uninvolved with the initial setup and transfer to the new phone.

Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Absolutely Astonished
reviewText:
Having recently transferred all the way to Apple products I have been blown away by how intuitive the devices were. This IMAC is almost like a piece of Alien technology to me. I generally just use my computer for everyday things and so have not much need of a 10 Core 10 CPU powerhouse.

I wanted something that would let me navigate the coming AI wave and grow with me for a few years. This is truly and amazing piece of hardware. It has taken me a while to get everything set up and connected (Accounts/Passwords), but it is truly beautiful to behold and amazing to operate.

Very happy with my purchase!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Apple products are GREAT, Apple service is terrible.
reviewText:
I like Apple products as long as I don’t have to deal with Apple. Apple service has diminished greatly of late. I went to the local Apple Store with the expectation of walking out of the store with both a new IMac and a new IPhone. This was being purchased for an 75-year old woman to replace her 11-year old IMac, which could no longer be updated (thanks Apple). There was nothing wrong with the original IMac except for this significant problem.

We were at the store 2-days before the release of the the latest IMac, but she wasn’t clutching her pearls waiting for the latest version. So we learn that the store has zero inventory to make room for the latest models. Brilliant shot in the foot Apple. An eager customer shows up at your door to drop $2,000, but they can’t.

We were able to walk out with an IPhone 14 (not the latest model). About 3-weeks into use of the phone, there was a problem connecting to her WiFi network, so she called Apple for assistance. Four hours later, she was unable to use either her old phone or her new one and Apple told her she needed to contact the phone service carrier. Again, thank you Apple. A 15-minute call with the carrier resolved everything even though they were completely uninvolved with the initial setup and transfer to the new phone.

Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024

We were at the store 2-days before the release of the the latest IMac, but she wasn’t clutching her pearls waiting for the latest version. So we learn that the store has zero inventory to make room for the latest models. Brilliant shot in the foot Apple. An eager customer shows up at your door to drop $2,000, but they can’t. We were able to walk out with an IPhone 14 (not the latest model). About 3-weeks into use of the phone, there was a problem connecting to her WiFi network, so she called Apple for assistance. Four hours later, she was unable to use either her old phone or her new one and Apple told her she needed to contact the phone service carrier. Again, thank you Apple. A 15-minute call with the carrier resolved everything even though they were completely uninvolved with the initial setup and transfer to the new phone. Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Absolutely Astonished
reviewText:
Having recently transferred all the way to Apple products I have been blown away by how intuitive the devices were. This IMAC is almost like a piece of Alien technology to me. I generally just use my computer for everyday things and so have not much need of a 10 Core 10 CPU powerhouse.

I wanted something that would let me navigate the coming AI wave and grow with me for a few years. This is truly and amazing piece of hardware. It has taken me a while to get everything set up and connected (Accounts/Passwords), but it is truly beautiful to behold and amazing to operate.

Very happy with my purchase!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Apple products are GREAT, Apple service is terrible.
reviewText:
I like Apple products as long as I don’t have to deal with Apple. Apple service has diminished greatly of late. I went to the local Apple Store with the expectation of walking out of the store with both a new IMac and a new IPhone. This was being purchased for an 75-year old woman to replace her 11-year old IMac, which could no longer be updated (thanks Apple). There was nothing wrong with the original IMac except for this significant problem.

We were at the store 2-days before the release of the the latest IMac, but she wasn’t clutching her pearls waiting for the latest version. So we learn that the store has zero inventory to make room for the latest models. Brilliant shot in the foot Apple. An eager customer shows up at your door to drop $2,000, but they can’t.

We were able to walk out with an IPhone 14 (not the latest model). About 3-weeks into use of the phone, there was a problem connecting to her WiFi network, so she called Apple for assistance. Four hours later, she was unable to use either her old phone or her new one and Apple told her she needed to contact the phone service carrier. Again, thank you Apple. A 15-minute call with the carrier resolved everything even though they were completely uninvolved with the initial setup and transfer to the new phone.

Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.

I wanted something that would let me navigate the coming AI wave and grow with me for a few years. This is truly and amazing piece of hardware. It has taken me a while to get everything set up and connected (Accounts/Passwords), but it is truly beautiful to behold and amazing to operate.

Very happy with my purchase!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Apple products are GREAT, Apple service is terrible.
reviewText:
I like Apple products as long as I don’t have to deal with Apple. Apple service has diminished greatly of late. I went to the local Apple Store with the expectation of walking out of the store with both a new IMac and a new IPhone. This was being purchased for an 75-year old woman to replace her 11-year old IMac, which could no longer be updated (thanks Apple). There was nothing wrong with the original IMac except for this significant problem.

We were at the store 2-days before the release of the the latest IMac, but she wasn’t clutching her pearls waiting for the latest version. So we learn that the store has zero inventory to make room for the latest models. Brilliant shot in the foot Apple. An eager customer shows up at your door to drop $2,000, but they can’t.

We were able to walk out with an IPhone 14 (not the latest model). About 3-weeks into use of the phone, there was a problem connecting to her WiFi network, so she called Apple for assistance. Four hours later, she was unable to use either her old phone or her new one and Apple told her she needed to contact the phone service carrier. Again, thank you Apple. A 15-minute call with the carrier resolved everything even though they were completely uninvolved with the initial setup and transfer to the new phone.

Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Absolutely Astonished
reviewText:
Having recently transferred all the way to Apple products I have been blown away by how intuitive the devices were. This IMAC is almost like a piece of Alien technology to me. I generally just use my computer for everyday things and so have not much need of a 10 Core 10 CPU powerhouse.

I wanted something that would let me navigate the coming AI wave and grow with me for a few years. This is truly and amazing piece of hardware. It has taken me a while to get everything set up and connected (Accounts/Passwords), but it is truly beautiful to behold and amazing to operate.

Very happy with my purchase!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Apple products are GREAT, Apple service is terrible.
reviewText:
I like Apple products as long as I don’t have to deal with Apple. Apple service has diminished greatly of late. I went to the local Apple Store with the expectation of walking out of the store with both a new IMac and a new IPhone. This was being purchased for an 75-year old woman to replace her 11-year old IMac, which could no longer be updated (thanks Apple). There was nothing wrong with the original IMac except for this significant problem.

We were at the store 2-days before the release of the the latest IMac, but she wasn’t clutching her pearls waiting for the latest version. So we learn that the store has zero inventory to make room for the latest models. Brilliant shot in the foot Apple. An eager customer shows up at your door to drop $2,000, but they can’t.

We were able to walk out with an IPhone 14 (not the latest model). About 3-weeks into use of the phone, there was a problem connecting to her WiFi network, so she called Apple for assistance. Four hours later, she was unable to use either her old phone or her new one and Apple told her she needed to contact the phone service carrier. Again, thank you Apple. A 15-minute call with the carrier resolved everything even though they were completely uninvolved with the initial setup and transfer to the new phone.

Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Absolutely Astonished
reviewText:
Having recently transferred all the way to Apple products I have been blown away by how intuitive the devices were. This IMAC is almost like a piece of Alien technology to me. I generally just use my computer for everyday things and so have not much need of a 10 Core 10 CPU powerhouse.

I wanted something that would let me navigate the coming AI wave and grow with me for a few years. This is truly and amazing piece of hardware. It has taken me a while to get everything set up and connected (Accounts/Passwords), but it is truly beautiful to behold and amazing to operate.

Very happy with my purchase!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Apple products are GREAT, Apple service is terrible.
reviewText:
I like Apple products as long as I don’t have to deal with Apple. Apple service has diminished greatly of late. I went to the local Apple Store with the expectation of walking out of the store with both a new IMac and a new IPhone. This was being purchased for an 75-year old woman to replace her 11-year old IMac, which could no longer be updated (thanks Apple). There was nothing wrong with the original IMac except for this significant problem.

We were at the store 2-days before the release of the the latest IMac, but she wasn’t clutching her pearls waiting for the latest version. So we learn that the store has zero inventory to make room for the latest models. Brilliant shot in the foot Apple. An eager customer shows up at your door to drop $2,000, but they can’t.

We were able to walk out with an IPhone 14 (not the latest model). About 3-weeks into use of the phone, there was a problem connecting to her WiFi network, so she called Apple for assistance. Four hours later, she was unable to use either her old phone or her new one and Apple told her she needed to contact the phone service carrier. Again, thank you Apple. A 15-minute call with the carrier resolved everything even though they were completely uninvolved with the initial setup and transfer to the new phone.

Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Apple products are GREAT, Apple service is terrible.
reviewText:
I like Apple products as long as I don’t have to deal with Apple. Apple service has diminished greatly of late. I went to the local Apple Store with the expectation of walking out of the store with both a new IMac and a new IPhone. This was being purchased for an 75-year old woman to replace her 11-year old IMac, which could no longer be updated (thanks Apple). There was nothing wrong with the original IMac except for this significant problem.

We were at the store 2-days before the release of the the latest IMac, but she wasn’t clutching her pearls waiting for the latest version. So we learn that the store has zero inventory to make room for the latest models. Brilliant shot in the foot Apple. An eager customer shows up at your door to drop $2,000, but they can’t.

We were able to walk out with an IPhone 14 (not the latest model). About 3-weeks into use of the phone, there was a problem connecting to her WiFi network, so she called Apple for assistance. Four hours later, she was unable to use either her old phone or her new one and Apple told her she needed to contact the phone service carrier. Again, thank you Apple. A 15-minute call with the carrier resolved everything even though they were completely uninvolved with the initial setup and transfer to the new phone.

Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024

Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Absolutely Astonished
reviewText:
Having recently transferred all the way to Apple products I have been blown away by how intuitive the devices were. This IMAC is almost like a piece of Alien technology to me. I generally just use my computer for everyday things and so have not much need of a 10 Core 10 CPU powerhouse.

I wanted something that would let me navigate the coming AI wave and grow with me for a few years. This is truly and amazing piece of hardware. It has taken me a while to get everything set up and connected (Accounts/Passwords), but it is truly beautiful to behold and amazing to operate.

Very happy with my purchase!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Absolutely Astonished
reviewText:
Having recently transferred all the way to Apple products I have been blown away by how intuitive the devices were. This IMAC is almost like a piece of Alien technology to me. I generally just use my computer for everyday things and so have not much need of a 10 Core 10 CPU powerhouse.

I wanted something that would let me navigate the coming AI wave and grow with me for a few years. This is truly and amazing piece of hardware. It has taken me a while to get everything set up and connected (Accounts/Passwords), but it is truly beautiful to behold and amazing to operate.

Very happy with my purchase!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Apple products are GREAT, Apple service is terrible.
reviewText:
I like Apple products as long as I don’t have to deal with Apple. Apple service has diminished greatly of late. I went to the local Apple Store with the expectation of walking out of the store with both a new IMac and a new IPhone. This was being purchased for an 75-year old woman to replace her 11-year old IMac, which could no longer be updated (thanks Apple). There was nothing wrong with the original IMac except for this significant problem.

We were at the store 2-days before the release of the the latest IMac, but she wasn’t clutching her pearls waiting for the latest version. So we learn that the store has zero inventory to make room for the latest models. Brilliant shot in the foot Apple. An eager customer shows up at your door to drop $2,000, but they can’t.

We were able to walk out with an IPhone 14 (not the latest model). About 3-weeks into use of the phone, there was a problem connecting to her WiFi network, so she called Apple for assistance. Four hours later, she was unable to use either her old phone or her new one and Apple told her she needed to contact the phone service carrier. Again, thank you Apple. A 15-minute call with the carrier resolved everything even though they were completely uninvolved with the initial setup and transfer to the new phone.

Apple products are high quality and recommended, but avoid Apple if at all possible.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 So much better than Windows!
reviewText: I am a Realtor and our office only had window computers. I have an iphone, Macbook and an ipad all that sync together so I can pick up where I left off when I'm working. I finally couldn't stand it anymore and purchase my own iMac for my office. I save so much time being able to airdrop from other agents, text agents and clients while I am working instead of having to stop what I am doing and pick up my phone to respond to a text. So many other benefits but I am envied by everyone else in the office that is still having to deal with their windows computer. Not to mention the speed and graphics on this are amazing!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2025

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 What an upgrade!
reviewText: After using a Dell for the last ten years and a Gateway before that, I was a little hesitant to switch to iMac because there is definitely a learning curve using a new operating system. However, it was easy to set up and going through the online user manual was helpful too. I bought the AppleCare too, and the tech was able to walk me through a few things I didn’t understand which differed from Windows. Also my email didn’t transfer over from the cloud even though all my photos and passwords did. But I shared my screen with the tech and he helped me resolve that problem. I’m still getting used to the new operating system but I love how fast it is and how crisp every looks. Very happy with the purchase.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2025

reviewTitle:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This was my most disappointing computer purchase in 42 years
reviewText: I bought my first computer in 1984. I had to hook it to the tv to use as a monitor. I have had probably 20 apple products and 50 pc's  between the house and my company. This Apple desk top was awful. The mouse never worked right. I had to click three or four times whenever I wanted to open something. The keyboard wouldn't work right most of the time. I would try to respond to an email and it wouldn't space or would freeze. If I shut off the whole system and rebooted it would work for awhile then freeze again. I have a 2 year old Apple mini and it is just fine. This unit was awful

reviewTitle:

    Please do not buy if you are not familiar with apple or mac
reviewText: Absolutely terrible system, you cannot do anything without apple id, when you try to register it needs not only email but also your phone and credit card information, after all the hassle, it tells you apple ID cannot be created at this time. After 30 minutes of googling, I found out a way to register an account by using apple music website, now I go back to mac and try to log in, password incorrect, after 3 failure it needs you to reset password, now the reset page tells my account doesnt exist even though I just created the account 1 minute ago with confirmation email from apple. Wasted me so much time and nothing work, it just now a beautiful piece of metal that does almost nothing.

reviewTitle:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This was my most disappointing computer purchase in 42 years
reviewText: I bought my first computer in 1984. I had to hook it to the tv to use as a monitor. I have had probably 20 apple products and 50 pc's  between the house and my company. This Apple desk top was awful. The mouse never worked right. I had to click three or four times whenever I wanted to open something. The keyboard wouldn't work right most of the time. I would try to respond to an email and it wouldn't space or would freeze. If I shut off the whole system and rebooted it would work for awhile then freeze again. I have a 2 year old Apple mini and it is just fine. This unit was awful

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 So much better than Windows!
reviewText: I am a Realtor and our office only had window computers. I have an iphone, Macbook and an ipad all that sync together so I can pick up where I left off when I'm working. I finally couldn't stand it anymore and purchase my own iMac for my office. I save so much time being able to airdrop from other agents, text agents and clients while I am working instead of having to stop what I am doing and pick up my phone to respond to a text. So many other benefits but I am envied by everyone else in the office that is still having to deal with their windows computer. Not to mention the speed and graphics on this are amazing!
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2025
reviewTitle_clean: 5.0 out of 5 stars So much better than Windows!

I save so much time being able to airdrop from other agents, text agents and clients while I am working instead of having to stop what I am doing and pick up my phone to respond to a text. So many other benefits but I am envied by everyone else in the office that is still having to deal with their windows computer. Not to mention the speed and graphics on this are amazing!

reviewTitle:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 What an upgrade!
reviewText: After using a Dell for the last ten years and a Gateway before that, I was a little hesitant to switch to iMac because there is definitely a learning curve using a new operating system. However, it was easy to set up and going through the online user manual was helpful too. I bought the AppleCare too, and the tech was able to walk me through a few things I didn’t understand which differed from Windows. Also my email didn’t transfer over from the cloud even though all my photos and passwords did. But I shared my screen with the tech and he helped me resolve that problem. I’m still getting used to the new operating system but I love how fast it is and how crisp every looks. Very happy with the purchase.
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2025

reviewTitle:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This was my most disappointing computer purchase in 42 years
reviewText: I bought my first computer in 1984. I had to hook it to the tv to use as a monitor. I have had probably 20 apple products and 50 pc's  between the house and my company. This Apple desk top was awful. The mouse never worked right. I had to click three or four times whenever I wanted to open something. The keyboard wouldn't work right most of the time. I would try to respond to an email and it wouldn't space or would freeze. If I shut off the whole system and rebooted it would work for awhile then freeze again. I have a 2 year old Apple mini and it is just fine. This unit was awful

reviewTitle:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Please do not buy if you are not familiar with apple or mac
reviewText: Absolutely terrible system, you cannot do anything without apple id, when you try to register it needs not only email but also your phone and credit card information, after all the hassle, it tells you apple ID cannot be created at this time. After 30 minutes of googling, I found out a way to register an account by using apple music website, now I go back to mac and try to log in, password incorrect, after 3 failure it needs you to reset password, now the reset page tells my account doesnt exist even though I just created the account 1 minute ago with confirmation email from apple. Wasted me so much time and nothing work, it just now a beautiful piece of metal that does almost nothing.
